title: Berkshire Live: Friday 10 February - BBC News
summary: bomb scare at newbury housing development .
london irish move to brentford a step closer .
reading boss wins manager of the month award .
daughter of 'british schindler ' criticises government on refugee policy .
soldier attacker branded 'calm and calculating ' by police .

documents.title: thanks for the memories
text: that is all for us today , and this week , thank you for joining us .
we will be back with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for berkshire on monday from 08:00 gmt .
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

documents.title: ready , set , go for the wokingham half marathon
text: now did you get some new running shoes for christmas ?
well this sunday might be your first chance to put them through their paces at the wokingham half marathon .
this year is the 32nd year the event has been staged , starting and finishing in cantley park .
organiser peter evans told bbc radio berkshire 's chris hollis he has been involved since the start .

documents.title: man sentenced for newbury gbh
text: a man from newbury who fractured a man 's eye socket and cheekbone in an attack in a pub in newbury has been jailed for two years .
thomas britzman , 22 , of avon way , newbury , pleaded guilty to one count of grevious bodily harm at reading crown court .
on 4 june 2016 , britzman .
punched a 29-year-old man , causing him to be knocked unconscious .
investigating officer det con claire midwinter , based at newbury police station , said : this was a nasty , unprovoked attack , which left the victim with lasting injuries .
the sentence he has received should serve as a warning to others , and demonstrates the seriousness with which offences of this nature are treated . ''
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

documents.title: traffic building across berkshire
text: traffic building across berkshire
author: Anoushka Williams
BBC Berkshire travel

documents.title: reading vs barnsley : 'both teams will be optimistic '
text: here are two in-form championship teams .
a couple of weeks ago , they were also two teams vying for a play-off spot .
but some reading fans are now getting carried away with life , and are wondering if they can catch second-placed brighton .
based on the last 10 years , to reach the championship play-offs , you need 73 points .
the automatic promotion figure is an average of 86 points .
if the next 16 games go as well as the most recent 16 , then reading will move beyond the 86-point mark .
both barnsley and reading will be optimistic as they move into the last three months of the season .
author: Tim Dellor
BBC Berkshire sport editor

documents.title: breakingmaidenhead man jailed for terrorist offences
text: a man from maidenhead who spoke of `` 40 trucks driving down oxford street full of explosives '' has been jailed for four years .
mohammed choudry was was found guilty of encouraging support for so-called islamic state , while part of an extremist group based in luton .
choudry was among a group of five covertly recorded when an undercover officer infiltrated their group over a 20-month period .
in what was described in court as a `` truly chilling '' speech during a gathering in 2015 , the 23-year-old said : `` a wave is coming .
either be a part of it or you drown '' .
he then described an attack on oxford street in london .
the court heard he was first set on the path of radicalisation when , at the age of 13 , he attended a speech in london by convicted terrorist omar brooks .
he was sentenced today along with four others from the extremist group .

documents.title: do n't you mean sully ?
text: london irish are clearly enjoying themselves ahead of their weekend off .
brendan mckibbin is lifting weights dressed as a sumo , and there is a mystery as to who the man in the background is .
that is definitely sully from monsters inc. though , and not the gruffalo .
# fridayfeeling @ twitterid is ready for the weekend !

# craic

that 's sully from monsters inc
indeed it is !
our excitement got the better of us there !
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

text: yann kermorgant has signed a new deal with reading , keeping him at the club for another year .
the frenchman is the royals ' highest scorer this season , netting eight times .
contract | we 're delighted to confirm that yann kermorgant has today penned a new contract until summer of 2018 !

documents.title: more breaking gritting news
text: yes , the big news of the day , there 's some snow .
do n't worry though , the council teams are all on to it .
primary routes in the borough will be gritted from 6.30pm today .
# rdguk # berksgrit
risk of snow and ice tonight ( 10 feb ) , primary routes will be gritted from 7pm .
drive safely this weekend .
for info :
author: John Hudson
BBC South

documents.title: pub and nightclub staff given police training
text: pub and nightclub managers in newbury are receiving police training on preventing alcohol-related disorder .
breathalyzers and body cameras have been purchased already for some of the businesses by thames valley police , the force said .
and at a symposium on tuesday officers will be giving them further guidance on spotting different types of vulnerability in people , and how these might manifest themselves .
inspector matthew lugg said : this will be a great opportunity for newbury 's businesses and charities to meet and engage with other people involved with the night time economy . ''

documents.title: it 's snowing in berkshire if you look hard enough
text: we 've seen two or three flakes here at bbc berkshire headquarters in caversham and it looks we 're in good company her majesty has a few outside her window too .
snow !
okay , it 's not windsor , ontario standards , but this definitely counts !
see ?
we 're not imagining things !
@ twitterid in # eton high street got real flakes !
'snowing in eton brrrr ! '
seems like eton is the place to be for a bit of snow @ twitterid
last one , i think our 'snowwww ! '
interest has lasted longer than the actual flurry
author: John Hudson
BBC South

documents.title: weather latest : freezing night ahead
text: after another cold start and the odd spot of snow , the chilly conditions are expected to continue .
temperatures will drop to 0c overnight with some more wintry showers possible .

documents.title: we did n't start the fire
text: the army bomb disposal team were called out to the site of the new housing development at newbury racecourse this lunchtime after builders discovered a `` sus package '' .
despite much chatter on social media , and police cordoning off a small area , it turned out to be an old fire extinguisher .
an onlooker told us that the army took it away i wonder if it will clean up and be of any use ?
breaking news : bomb disposal spotted on newbury racecourse this afternoon !
kpm reporters on the scene # newbury @ twitterid @ twitterid
thanks @ twitterid we 're looking into it now .
is there anything else you can tell us ?
will @ twitterid would be happy to give an interview as we have some exciting news .
author: John Hudson
BBC South

documents.title: tilehurst precinct gets new lease of life
text: after years of planning - the go ahead has been given to renovate meadway precinct in tilehurst .
on wednesday , reading borough council 's planning committee approved the planning application to refurbish shops and build new ones .
the precinct , which was initially built in the 1960s , will also provide 200 parking spaces .
councillors also heard that boots has agreed to a new lease until 2029 .
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

documents.title: jaap 's magic month
text: jaap stam has been named as the championship manager of the month for january .
he won four of his six league games during the month , with the royals sitting third in the table .
these were the key matches .
2 january : bristol city 2-3 reading
24 january - reading 1-0 fulham
28 january - reading 2-1 cardiff
31 january - birmingham 0-1 reading
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

documents.title: who ya gon na call ?
text: the royal borough of windsor and maidenhead 's gritters , apparently .
they are preparing for another cold evening across the county , with the met office expecting temperatures to drop to freezing tonight .
the gritters will be heading out at 5pm to salt primary routes # drivesafe # grittertwitter
author: Adam Whitty
BBC South

documents.title: london irish move to brentford a step closer
text: london irish , who currently play their home games at reading fc 's madejski stadium , are a step closer to moving away from berkshire .
last night , hounslow council gave approval for rugby use at brentford community stadium , which is the proposed new home of brentford fc from the 2019/2020 season .
irish chief executive bob casey has said he is now looking forward to taking `` discussions with brentford fc to the next stage '' .
author: Adam Williams
BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : the archaeological legacy of crossrail excavations
text: when the time comes to hop on a crossrail into london , here 's something to think about .
discoveries made during their rail excavations have included the skeletons of plague victims , a tudor bowling ball and medieval ice skates fashioned from animal bones .
these are among hundreds of artefacts being displayed at a new exhibition .

documents.title: daughter of 'british schindler ' criticises government on refugee policy
text: the daughter of a maidenhead holocaust hero who rescued hundreds of children from nazi concentration camps has criticised the government 's refugee policy .

barbara winton , whose father sir nicholas winton was hailed as the `` british schindler '' for his efforts during world war ii , has asked theresa may to reverse her decision to end the `` dubs amendment '' scheme which let unaccompanied migrant children into the uk .
she told the bbc : `` she spoke very movingly about what he had done at the memorial .

`` so my appeal really was to remind her of those sentiments that she had put forward , and ask for a consideration for these children who are in such similar positions to those my father rescued in 1939 . ''
campaigners will challenge the government 's handling of child refugees at a high court hearing later today .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: soldier attacker branded 'calm and calculating ' by police
text: a soldier jailed for a minimum of 16 years yesterday for trying to kill his love rival with cling film and a jab saw has been described as `` calm and calculating '' by police .
in a statement released today , investigating officer detective constable lyndsey shaw said the sentence `` reflects the severity '' of john watson 's actions .
watson committed a cold and calculated offence - the examination of his phone showed that he had been planning the offence in the days leading up to the incident , '' she said .
`` this included a checklist of the items he needed in order to commit the offence and several notes he had planned to send to family and friends to explain the disappearance of the victim . ''
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: safety bus moves to reading minster
text: a safety bus for people on a night out in reading has a new permanent home .
from tonight first stop - which has helped 1,200 people needing physical help or emotional support at its broad street base in the last four years - will move to reading minister .
the church already operates its own nigh-time sanctuary scheme , and reverend steven pullin told bbc radio berkshire the change would be an opportunity to combine resources .
he said : `` we are keen to make the best use of the minster to serve and support people in the town and we 're looking forward to joining forces with the first stop team . ''

documents.title: more help needed for tinnitus sufferers
text: south today have been to the royal berkshire hospital to see some of the treatments available for patients , as campaigners call for more help at gp level .

documents.title: volunteer police cadet scheme launched
text: a new volunteer police cadet unit has opened in west berkshire .
the self-funding scheme aims to help youngsters aged 13 to 18 to develop their qualities and skills through a structured programme .

inspector mark tucker , who heads up the unit which met for the first time on tuesday , said : this is an exciting initiative for young people who may have an interest in the police service and a desire to help the local community .
over the last few months we have recruited a number of adult cadet leaders from within and outside the service , and we are all looking forward to working together to make the new unit a success . ''

documents.title: soldier begins jail sentence for attempted murder
text: a soldier who abducted and stabbed his love rival has been jailed for a minimum of 16 years .
john watson , 35 , ambushed pte james dicks outside his ex-wife 's home in windsor because he believed they were in a relationship .
he then tied pte dicks up , bundled him into a car and stabbed him before he was stopped by police .
judge angela morris said watson was a `` danger to the public '' as she sentenced him at reading crown court .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: sonning residents george and amal clooney are 'expecting twins '
text: prominent human rights lawyer amal clooney and her husband , award-winning actor george , are expecting twins , us media report .
the babies are due in june , according to cbs 's the talk host julie chen .
another source close to the couple , quoted by people , said they were `` very happy '' .
the clooneys ' representatives have not yet commented .
the couple married in venice in 2014 with a star-studded list of guests including matt damon and bill murray .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: weather latest : cold day ahead
text: a chilly day lies ahead with highs of around 4c , and brisk winds will make it feel even colder .
some light wintry showers are also possible later in the day .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to the bbc 's local live service for berkshire .
we will be bringing you all of the royal county 's latest news , travel , sport and weather until 18:00 .
stay in touch via our twitter and facebook pages .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South
